titleStmt.title: J. J. Harrison to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2277

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Hartford Ohio Co
Ky Nov 8th 1865
TO Thos E Bramlett Gov, of Ky --
Dear Sir

There is a vacancy in our county of two Magistrates Wm H. Rock of District No 2. In his place you have already appointed T. W. Taylor who refuses to accept your commission you will therefore please commission Samuel Shull as Justice of the Peace in said district -- who will act if commissioned. Also in District No you will please commission George R. Coleman in the place of R. A. Taylor resigned

Respectfully
J. J. Harrison
Presiding Judge of the Ohio County Court

Justice Peace
Ohio County
Saml' Shull
Dis No 2
&
Geo R. Coleman
Dis 3
apptd
13th Nov/65
